code: @Manual{,   title = {openMSE: Easily Install and Load the 'openMSE' Packages},   author = {Adrian Hordyk and Quang Huynh and Tom Carruthers},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.1, https://github.com/Blue-Matter/openMSE, https://openMSE.openMSE.com},   url = {https://openmse.com/}, }

what: Easily Install and Load the openMSE Packages
title: Easily Install and Load the openMSE Packages
text: openMSE umbrella R package building operating models, analyzing fishery data, conducting Management Strategy Evaluation (MSE) wide range fisheries. Installing openMSE package loading library("openMSE") load following core packages: MSEtool - Management Strategy Evaluation toolkit core package openMSE collection. contains core functions constructing operating models, simulating fishery dynamics, evaluating effectiveness alternative management strategies using closed-loop simulation testing. DLMtool - Data-Limited Methods toolkit collection data-limited management procedures can evaluated using MSE. DLMtool requires MSEtool package dependency, MSEtool functions available DLMtool loaded R session. SAMtool - Stock Assessment Methods toolkit collection assessment methods management procedures developed data-intensive applications. package includes Rapid Conditioning Model conditioning operating models data-moderate data-rich fisheries. SAMtool requires MSEtool package dependency, MSEtool functions available SAMtool loaded R session. can learn openMSE packages openMSE documentation site.

title: Easily Install and Load the openMSE Packages
text: can install released version openMSE CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("openMSE") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Blue-Matter/openMSE")

title: Easily Install and Load the openMSE Packages
text: demo function runs example MSE using three data-limited management procedures DLMtool one stock assessment model SAMtool, demonstrates example plotting output:

title: Run an example MSE — demo

what: Create a data.frame with estimated values from a SAMtool assessment method used in an MSE — get_Assess_Estimates
title: Create a data.frame with estimated values from a SAMtool assessment method used in an MSE — get_Assess_Estimates
text: Create data.frame estimated values SAMtool assessment method used MSE

title: Create a data.frame with estimated values from a SAMtool assessment method used in an MSE — get_Assess_Estimates
code: get_Assess_Estimates(x, model = "Model 1")  # S3 method for class 'MSE' get_Assess_Estimates(x, model = "Model 1")  # S3 method for class 'list' get_Assess_Estimates(x, model = NULL)  # S3 method for class 'MMSE' get_Assess_Estimates(x, model = NULL)

title: Create a data.frame with estimated values from a SAMtool assessment method used in an MSE — get_Assess_Estimates
text: x object class MSE list MSE objects, MSE includes management procedures use SAMtool stock assessment functions return estimated values MSE@PPD. model optional name model. x list objects, model taken names(x). names(x) NULL, model given sequential numerical values (e.g., Model 1, Model 2, ...)

title: Create a data.frame with estimated values from a SAMtool assessment method used in an MSE — get_Assess_Estimates

title: Create a data.frame with time-series information by simulation and year — get_at_age_ts
text: x object class Hist, MSE, list Hist MSE objects variable character string valid name time-series variable. Use valid_ts_variables() valid variable names. model optional name model. x list objects, model taken names(x). names(x) NULL, model given sequential numerical values (e.g., Model 1, Model 2, ...) scale optional function single numeric argument returns transformed scaled numeric values. See lb2kg kg2lb example. Can list functions list objects (NA transformation)

title: Create a data.frame with time-series information by simulation and year — get_ts
code: get_ts(x, variable = "Spawning Biomass", model = "Model 1", scale = NULL)  valid_ts_variables()  valid_at_age_ts_variables()  # S3 method for class 'Hist' get_ts(x, variable = "Spawning Biomass", model = "Model 1", scale = NULL)  # S3 method for class 'MSE' get_ts(x, variable = "Spawning Biomass", model = "Model 1", scale = NULL)  # S3 method for class 'list' get_ts(x, variable = "Spawning Biomass", model = "Model 1", scale = NULL)  # S3 method for class 'multiHist' get_ts(x, variable = "Spawning Biomass", model = "Model 1", scale = NULL)  # S3 method for class 'MMSE' get_ts(x, variable = "Spawning Biomass", model = "Model 1", scale = NULL)  get_Biomass(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_Landings(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_Removals(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_Recruits(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_SSB(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_SB_SBMSY(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_F(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_Biomass_at_Age(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_Number_at_Age(x, model = "Model 1", ...)  get_SSB_at_Age(x, model = "Model 1", ...)

title: Create a data.frame with time-series information by simulation and year — get_ts
text: x object class Hist, MSE, list Hist MSE objects variable character string valid name time-series variable. Use valid_ts_variables() valid variable names. model optional name model. x list objects, model taken names(x). names(x) NULL, model given sequential numerical values (e.g., Model 1, Model 2, ...) scale optional function single numeric argument returns transformed scaled numeric values. See lb2kg kg2lb example. Can list functions list objects (NA transformation) ... named arguments passed get_ts

what: Plots the median and quantiles of a time-series — plot_TS
title: Plots the median and quantiles of a time-series — plot_TS
text: Plots median quantiles time-series

title: Plots the median and quantiles of a time-series — plot_TS
code: plot_TS(   x,   xlab = "Year",   ylab = "Spawning Biomass",   title = "",   quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975),   scale = NULL,   alpha = 0.1,   lwd = 1,   use_theme = NULL,   colpalette = "Dark2",   facet = TRUE,   inc.Legend = !facet,   inc.Hist = FALSE,   print = TRUE,   get_function = get_SSB,   years = NULL,   ... )  plot_SSB(x, ...)  plot_Biomass(x, ylab = "Biomass", ...)  plot_Landings(x, ylab = "Landings", ...)  plot_Removals(x, ylab = "Removals", ...)  plot_Recruits(x, ylab = "Recruits", ...)  plot_F(x, ylab = "Fishing Mortality (F)", ...)  plot_LifeHistory(   x,   xlab = "Year",   ylab = "Median (quantiles)",   title = "",   quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975),   scale = NULL,   alpha = 0.1,   lwd = 1,   use_theme = NULL,   colpalette = "Dark2",   facet = TRUE,   inc.Legend = !facet,   inc.Hist = FALSE,   print = TRUE )

title: Plots the median and quantiles of a time-series — plot_TS
text: x object class Hist, MSE, list Hist MSE objects xlab X-axis label (default 'Year') ylab Y-axes label title Optional title quantiles Lower upper quantiles calculate. Numeric vector length 2. scale optional function single numeric argument returns transformed scaled numeric values. See lb2kg kg2lb example. Can list functions list objects (NA transformation) alpha Transparency parameter lwd Line width use_theme Optional ggplot theme colpalette Color palette RColorBrewer facet Logical. Facet plot? inc.Legend Logical. Include legend? inc.Hist Logical. MSE results, include historical period? print Logical. Print plot? get_function get_ function extract time-series information x years Optional numeric vector specifying years plot. Default years. ... Named arguments passed plot_TS

title: Plots the median and quantiles of a time-series — plot_TS
text: named list :

title: Plots the median and quantiles of a time-series — plot_TS
text: plot_SSB(): Plot Spawning Biomass plot_Biomass(): Plot Total Biomass plot_Landings(): Plot Landings (biomass) plot_Removals(): Plot Removals (biomass) plot_Recruits(): Plot Recruits (numbers) plot_F(): Plot Recruits (numbers) plot_LifeHistory(): Plot Life-History parameters

title: Plot at-Age schedules — plot_at_Age
text: Plots Length, Weight, Maturity, Natural-Mortality, Selectivity, Retention--Age schedules.

title: Plot at-Age schedules — plot_at_Age
code: plot_at_Age(   x,   quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975),   scale = NULL,   variable = "Length",   xlab = "Age (Year)",   ylab = NULL,   title = "",   years = NULL,   alpha = 0.1,   lwd = 1,   use_theme = NULL,   colpalette = "Dark2",   print = TRUE )  plot_Length(x, ...)  plot_Weight(x, ...)  plot_Maturity(x, ...)  plot_N.Mortality(x, ...)  plot_Select(x, ...)  plot_Retention(x, ...)  plot_Select_Maturity(x, ...)

title: Plot at-Age schedules — plot_at_Age
text: x object class Hist, MSE, list Hist MSE objects quantiles Lower upper quantiles calculate. Numeric vector length 2. scale optional function single numeric argument returns transformed scaled numeric values. See lb2kg kg2lb example. Can list functions list objects (NA transformation) variable String. One 'Length', 'Weight', 'N.Mortality','Maturity', 'Select', 'Retention' xlab X-axis label (default 'Age (Year)') ylab Y-axes label title Optional title years Optional numeric vector specifying years plot. Default first last historical year, last projection year alpha Transparency parameter lwd Line width use_theme Optional ggplot theme colpalette Color palette RColorBrewer print Logical. Print plot? ... Named arguments passed plot_at_Age

title: Plot at-Age schedules — plot_at_Age
text: named list :

title: Plot at-Age schedules — plot_at_Age
text: Note Selectivity Retention curves plots operating model. MP changes selectivity/retention, shown plots.

title: Plot at-Age schedules — plot_at_Age
text: plot_Length(): Plot Length--Age plot_Weight(): Plot Weight--Age plot_Maturity(): Plot Maturity--Age plot_N.Mortality(): Plot N.Mortality--Age plot_Select(): Plot Selectivity--Age plot_Retention(): Plot Retention --Age plot_Select_Maturity(): Plot Selectivity-, Retention-, Maturity--Age

what: Convert numeric values to a different scale — lb2kg
title: Convert numeric values to a different scale — lb2kg
text: Convert numeric values different scale

title: Convert numeric values to a different scale — lb2kg
code: lb2kg(x)  lb2mt(x)  kg2lb(x)  kg2_1000lb(x)  kg2mt(x)  inch2mm(x)  inch2cm(x)  mm2inch(x)  cm2inch(x)  divide_1000(x)  divide_100(x)  divide_10(x)  multiply_1000(x)  multiply_100(x)  multiply_10(x)

title: Convert numeric values to a different scale — lb2kg
text: x vector numeric values

title: Convert numeric values to a different scale — lb2kg
text: vector numeric values converted appropriate scale

title: Convert numeric values to a different scale — lb2kg
text: lb2kg(): Convert pounds kilograms lb2mt(): Convert pounds metric tons kg2lb(): Convert kilograms pounds kg2_1000lb(): Convert kilograms 1000 pounds kg2mt(): Convert kilograms metric tons inch2mm(): Convert inches millimeters inch2cm(): Convert inches centimeters mm2inch(): Convert millimeters inches cm2inch(): Convert centimeters inches divide_1000(): Divide values 1000 divide_100(): Divide values 100 divide_10(): Divide values 10 multiply_1000(): Multiply values 1000 multiply_100(): Multiply values 100 multiply_10(): Multiply values 10

title: Convert numeric values to a different scale — lb2kg
A ggplot2 theme — theme_default
text: simple theme ggplot2 loosely resembles nicely themed plots base graphics.

title: A ggplot2 theme — theme_default
code: theme_default(   base_size = 11,   base_family = "",   text_col = "grey20",   panel_border_col = "grey70" )

title: A ggplot2 theme — theme_default
text: base_size Base font size. base_family Base font family. text_col Color text. panel_border_col Color panel borders.

title: A ggplot2 theme — theme_default
code: p <- ggplot2::ggplot(mtcars) +   ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(gear))) +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(~am) p + theme_default()

what: Open the openMSE Documentation website — userguide
title: Open the openMSE Documentation website — userguide
text: Opens openMSE Documentation website (requires internet connection)

title: Open the openMSE Documentation website — userguide
code: userguide()

title: Open the openMSE Documentation website — userguide
text: Nothing returned. Opens 'openMSE.com' web browser

title: Open the openMSE Documentation website — userguide
code: userguide()

title: openMSE 1.0.1
text: Added functions generating dataframes Hist MSE objects, plotting time series biomass, landings, removals, etc. See https://openmse.openmse.com/ details.

title: openMSE 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-08 openMSE released CRAN!
